# How to collapse data.frames using an index

## collapseData() is a general function to summarize data based on tapply()
## It collapse a vector based on a user-define function and an index/factor

### An example here: create a data.frame with repeated values in column 1
```
dat <- data.frame(IDS=rep(letters[1:3], each=3), Values=1:9)
```

### Collapse the information based on the index in column one using collapseData()
### By default the summarization is obtained by computing the mean()
```
collapsedValues <- collapseData(dat$Values, dat$IDS)
```

### An alternative function can be passed
```
collapsedValues <- collapseData(dat$Values, dat$IDS, func=sum)
```

### It can be sued over the columns coupling it with apply()
```
collapsedValues <- apply(dat, 2, collapseData, ind=dat$IDS, func=function(x) x[1] )
```

## collapseSelectOutput() can be used to collapse annotation data.frames generated by select()
```
require(TxDb.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.knownGene)
keytypes(TxDb.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.knownGene)
ann <- select(TxDb.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.knownGene, c("1", "2", "3"), keytype="GENEID", columns=c("TXID", "TXNAME"))
collapseSelectOutput(ann)
```
